title: What is the doctrine of the quadruple body and how can it be practiced in ritual for spiritual awareness?
first_phrase: In this text, the author discusses the ancient doctrine of the quadruple body. The doctrine teaches that human beings are made up of four elements: body, soul, spirit, and mind. The author explains that the consciousness of these elements is achieved through a ritual silence. The author clarifies that the term "consciousness" used here does not refer to brain activity or thinking but rather to the act of the spirit Mero. After achieving this state of consciousness through the ritual, the practitioner can observe the gradual separation of each "body" until the perception of four distinct elements, each with its own unique attributes and functions. The last 200 tokens describe the author's suggestions for practical realization of this experience.
content: Vi è chi, dopo avere compiuto il Rito ed avere realizzato in esso tale stato di coscienza, vi ripensa, se ne ricorda, ad un tempo in modo lucido e vago, senza poter giungere ad espri merlo. Ciò è esatto. AI primo atto, in cui la coscienza realizza la quadru plice realtà dell'essere, segue, nel Rito eseguito con calma, senza precipitazione, con « fuoco lento », la gra duale, phl perfetta e completa esperienza della lenta separazione di ciascun « corpo » dagli altri, fino alla per cezione di quattro elementi, assolutamente distinti l'uno dall'altro e con attributi e funzioni peculiari a ciascuno di essi. Contemporaneamente la coscienza osserva (s'in tenda rettamente anche questo termine) i vari modi di essere dei corpi, impara a conoscerli.
last_phrase: In conclusion, it is essential to execute the Rite slowly and deliberately, allowing the gradual separation of each "body" and the perception of the four distinct elements. Rushing through the process can cause a reaction that immediately dissipates the state of experience, making it difficult to regain. Practitioners must take their time and observe the various ways of being of the bodies. By doing so, they can achieve a deep understanding and perfect recall of the elements, which is vital for successful magical and theurgical practices.
